They can be viewed under ["runner-gearpump" component](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-2693?jql=project%20%3D%20BEAM%20AND%20component%20%3D%20runner-gearpump%20ORDER%20BY%20updated%20DESC%2C%20priority%20DESC%2C%20created%20ASC). R: @robertwb 

cc: @jkff
@jkff the test runs around 10 seconds, maybe because you see the TimeOut above is 60 seconds. I think 10 seconds can be enough.
The "classic" TLS/SSL with server certificate already works and it's still working of course.

I agree with the idea that SSL end to end should be tested via integration tests, not unit tests.  It would be interesting to ask if the createClient() method should be unit tested or not.  Basically - is there something we should be doing in unit tests to make sure that the setup is getting put in correctly? I'm not sure if that's a good idea or not. If there's no interesting logic, then it's probably not worth it.

cc @chamikaramj for questions about the integration tests
If needed, I can provide the Shield configuration for the Elasticsearch instance used in the integration tests.

@takidau I think you need to do a full `mvn clean` in the ROOT directory of beam source code.

LGTM.

What's left:

- [x] Decide on how we want to handle Kafka version upgrade. My choice : upgrade Beam to 0.11 and let it work with older version at run, user would still have an option to use older versions.
- [x] Add a runtime version check, and a runner check (some runners may not provide required semantics).
- [x] Fix how `MockProducer` is used in existing sink tests.
- [ ] Add a few unit tests
- [ ] (may be) add an option for user to discard existing Kafka metadata to simplify handling restart of a job from scratch.
Unrelated java failure. Retest this please.
Didn't help. Talked w/ tgroh, looks like this is probably due to [PR 3334](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3334). Filed [BEAM-2707](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-2707).
Note to self: submit https://github.com/apache/beam-site/pull/278 after this one.
LGTM
R: @tgroh
Yes. It indicates it was expecting 10 things, but could only find the first 5.
Also I'm assuming the other modes either don't have this style of stream available or have tests already associated with them.
R: @jbonofre AND @tgroh

I didn't look into the other formats to see if they have other concatenated modes we should support. I did look into the other modes that are listed and make sure they didn't have constructor parameters / configurations suggesting they were truncating things.

cc: @aaltay

Hey @chuanyu, thank you for your first contribution. I believe `typing` module is only available in python 3.5+, Beam Python SDK currently does not support Python 3. And this change should happen together with a grand change that upgrades all of SDK to support Python 3. Would you be interested in doing that? If you are interested, a good step would be preparing a plan and sharing with the dev list.

To be clear, I do not think we should do this change in isolation.

Hi @aaltay, thanks for the quick reply! The `typing` module has actually been [backported to pre-3.5 versions](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/typing/3.6.1), and type annotations are even available in Python 2.7 and up as type comments. It would be useful to be able to use the `typing` module types for Beam typehints as well, especially when the types are complicated. 

No worries if you'd prefer not to include this change in isolation - perhaps use of typing in pre-3.5 is not common enough for this to be a frequent request.

Perhaps we should consider encouraging using standard Python typing instead of our type annotations since @chuanyu indicates it is broadly available.  Robert, have you seen any issues that preclude this use?
